content.1: Awake, awake; put on thy strength, O Zion; put on thy beautiful garments, O Jerusalem, the holy city: for henceforth there shall no more come into thee the uncircumcised and the unclean.
content.2: Shake thyself from the dust; arise,
content.5: Now therefore, what have I here, saith the
content.6: Therefore my people shall know my name: therefore
content.7: How beautiful upon the mountains are the feet of him that bringeth good tidings, that publisheth peace; that bringeth good tidings of good, that publisheth salvation; that saith unto Zion, Thy God reigneth!
content.8: Thy watchmen shall lift up the voice; with the voice together shall they sing: for they shall see eye to eye, when the
content.9: Break forth into joy, sing together, ye waste places of Jerusalem: for the
content.11: Depart ye, depart ye, go ye out from thence, touch no unclean
content.12: For ye shall not go out with haste, nor go by flight: for the
content.13: Behold, my servant shall deal prudently, he shall be exalted and extolled, and be very high.
content.14: As many were astonied at thee; his visage was so marred more than any man, and his form more than the sons of men:
content.15: So shall he sprinkle many nations; the kings shall shut their mouths at him: for
